content:
Testing Familiarity:
- Confluence track page: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2022-01+Da+Vinci+Risk+Adjustment
o Testing instructions: Track Details/Kickoff presentation
- Risk Adjustment repository: https://github.com/HL7/davinci-ra
o Postman test scripts: /input/tests/davinci-ra.postman_collection.json
 Set Variables (click “22-01 Connectathon 29”, Variables tab, Current Value)
 Run Risk Adjustment/Config (also includes the examples from the IG)
- Risk Adjustment IG: https://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/davinci-ra/branches/master/
o Submit issues (Footer, “Propose a change”, submit tracker)
- Conman: http://conman.clinfhir.com/connectathon.html?event=con29 (different for each Connectathon)
o Track details & testing/Da Vinci Risk Adjustment/Testing & feedback
- Touchstone: https://touchstone.aegis.net/touchstone/testdefinitions
o Test Definitions/FHIR Sandbox/DaVinci/FHIR-0-1-RA
 04-RA-ReportParameters
 05-RA-ReportResults
Hey! Is there an R4 FHIR Risk Adjustment API spec we can check out and try calling in a Sandbox?

Hello @Rebecca Groner. There is a Reference Implementation. There are still some tweaks being made, but it's _mostly_ correct.

This is the easiest way to spin it up: https://github.com/DBCG/cqf-ruler#docker.
Thanks! Is this considered an R4 FHIR resource? Any idea when it'll be good to go universally from HL7/FHIR?

Yes, it is R4.
I think it depends on what you mean by "good to go universally" It's currently in draft, undergoing STU1 balloting.

I don't know the plans for STU 2 - Normative. @Yan Heras ?

Hi @Rebecca Groner We are currently working on ballot reconciliation for STU1. We are also beginning requirement analysis for STU2 and plan to ballot STU2 hopefully in the Sept. ballot cycle this year. The Da Vinci Risk Adjustment community meets Thursdays 3pm - 4pm ET. Here is the link to the confluence site, where you can find the meeting information, etc. https://confluence.hl7.org/display/DVP/Risk+Adjustment
Also, you can see the targeted time line for taking RA to normative in the PSS: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CQIWC/FHIR+Risk+Adjustment+PSS
